intro: Tithymalus myrtifolius, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tithymalus myrtifolius is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and can also attract beneficial insects.
